result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark J. Kemps was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Expose Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Paid.  Bond applied.  Balance of bond to be returned to poster.

The Defendant is to undergo a mental health assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment/counseling.  The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  Defendant may not withdraw from any ordered program without permission of the agent and/or provider.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is to take prescribed medication as prescribed.  The Defendant is to have no contact with minors unless approved by Agent.  Defendant is to complete and participate in sexual offender risk assessment / treatment as required.  Defendant is to submit to polygraph examinations as required.  Defendant is not to use computers, electronic devices, or the internet unless approved by Agent.  Defendant is not to access dating, romantic, or sexual relationship based websites.    The Defendant is to comply with sex offender registry.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
